page.title: 18CROFTING IN DORNIE
page.content: The majority of the land in the Dornie area is given over to rough grazing.There is very little intensive agriculture. However round Bundalloch there are a number of crofts.These crofts are run on traditional lines some with stock rearing in particular sheep being the main crop.Some also have cattle but the system of having a milking cow is gradually disappearing. There is not a great deal of arable farming but the crofts do cut hay for their cattle and a few raise corn on a fairly small scale.The crofters plant potatoes for their own family use.The sheep spend most of their time on the hill and lambing takes place on the open ground.The cattle are out in the grassy areas in the Summer but are usually brought in during the Winter.
